alert.note: Alert for Ford; Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued May 07 at 10:00PM CDT until May 07 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR FORD AND SOUTHWESTERN IROQUOIS COUNTIES... At 1000 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Aroma Park to near Gilman to near Paxton to Fisher, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Including the following interstate... I-57 between mile markers 258 and 288. This dust channel will remain over mainly rural areas of Ford and southwestern Iroquois Counties, including the following locations... Melvin, Thawville, Loda, Elliott, Roberts, Clarence and Danforth. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
